lead_paragraph: During closing arguments, lawyers for the correction officers accused of beating of Jahmal Lightfoot said that he was armed and had to be forcibly restrained.

byline.original: By WINNIE HU and KATE PASTOR

headline.print_headline: Defense Calls Rikers Inmate an Aggressor, Not a Victim
headline.main: Defense for Rikers Island Guards Calls Inmate an Aggressor, Not a Victim

snippet: During closing arguments, lawyers for the correction officers accused of beating of Jahmal Lightfoot said that he was armed and had to be forcibly restrained.
abstract: Defense lawyers for nine Rikers Island corrections officers charged with gang assault argue in closing statements that inmate Jahmal Lightfoot had to be forcibly restrained after resisting order to drop his weapon; prosecutors argue Lightfoot was unfairly targeted and officers planted weapon on him.
